intro: Fuirena umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Fuirena umbellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
